title: About
markdown: The AMP-AD Knowledge Portal is a platform for accessing data, analyses, and tools that the National Institute on Aging’s Alzheimer's Disease Translational Research Program generates. The program encourages open-science collaborations that share resources early in the research life cycle. Named for the Accelerating Medicines Partnership in Alzheimer’s Disease Target Discovery and Preclinical Validation Project, the AMP-AD Knowledge Portal includes “omics” data from human samples and experimental model systems, as well as bioinformatic analyses from research teams and cross-consortium working groups. To access these resources, follow the instructions on this page. The AMP-AD Knowledge Portal is funded by the National Institute on Aging, and is developed and maintained by Sage Bionetworks. If you have suggestions or feedback about the AMP-AD Knowledge Portal, please contact us.
